title: CSS Fundamentals
description: Test your understanding of CSS fundamentals and styling

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to change the text color?
questions.explanation: The `color` property is used to change the text color in CSS.

questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets.

questions.question: Which of the following are CSS box model properties?
questions.explanation: The `margin`, `padding`, and `border` are CSS box model properties.

questions.question: Which CSS selector targets elements with a specific class?
questions.explanation: The `.` selector is used to target elements with a specific class.

questions.question: What is the default value of the position property?
questions.explanation: The `static` is the default value of the position property.

questions.question: Which CSS units are relative?
questions.explanation: The `em` and `rem` are relative CSS units.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to create space between elements?
questions.explanation: The `margin` is used to create space between elements.

questions.question: What does the z-index property control?
questions.explanation: The `z-index` property controls the stacking order of elements.
